did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, minutes, articles, records, lecture notes, exams, manuscripts, research material.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
did.abstract: Professional papers of Adrian M. Srb, geneticist and professor of plant breeding at Cornell.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Adrian Srb earned a bachelor's degree in English literature and a master's degree in agronomy from the University of Nebraska. He then earned a doctorate in biology in 1937 from Stanford University, where he taught until coming to Cornell in 1947 as an associate professor of plant breeding. He wrote numerous articles and papers on the genetics, physiology, and development of fungi, including the bread mold Neurospora and baker's yeast. At Cornell, he taught General Genetics, and authored the textbook General Genetics. He was elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in 1941, and to the National Academy of Sciences in 1968. Born in 1917, Adrian Srb died in 1997.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Professional papers include correspondence with colleagues and students; class and course notes for general genetics and human genetics courses; research materials, including notes and charts relating to Neurospora; files relating to professional organizations, seminars, and conferences; files relating to activities at Cornell, particularly the creation of the Division of Biological Sciences; grant applications; and manuscripts for books.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. Division of Biological Sciences.

scopecontent.p: The rest of this box contains miscellaneous notebooks consisting of charts, graphs, diagrams and observations Srb made during his years of research.
